title: (x) Mystery character - logicalnot {Steve\_P, Kent}
content:
Anyone know what this character is, and what it's for?   
   
ASCII 194   
   
 ![mysterychar.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080330212113im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/12473.gif)

 [‹ Archive through July 03, 2003](http://web.archive.org/web/20080330212113/http:/www.typophile.com/node/546 "Go to previous forum topic") [Herbalife font id ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080330212113/http:/www.typophile.com/node/505 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content:
IIRC, it's a mathematical/logic symbol.   
I think its name appears on Fog, I just don't have it installed here right now.

The Postscript name is _logicalnot._ Bringhurst says that it is used for negation in symbolic logic. He also calls it an _angled dash._   
   
-- K.

_\> He also calls it an angled dash._   
   
_Crooked dash_ or _post-car-crash dash_ is more like it. ;)   
THX everyone for the explanations, I owe you one.   
(The pertinent question being "which one?")

\>Crooked dash or post-car-crash dash is more like it. ;)   
   
"Viagra-not"?   
   
Sorry. Last day before a long weekend + week off.

\>Sorry. Last day before a long weekend + week off.   
   
Must dash?   
   
   
   
sorry.
